test.code:
import random

def test_is_simple_power():
    # Test with thousands of random test cases
    for _ in range(10000):
        n = random.randint(2, 100)  # n should start from 2 to ensure valid power checks
        exp = random.randint(0, 10)
        x = n ** exp
        assert is_simple_power(x, n), f"Failed for x={x}, n={n}"
        
        # Testing negative cases
        x = random.randint(1, 10000)
        if x != n ** exp:
            assert not is_simple_power(x, n), f"Incorrectly passed for x={x}, n={n}"

    # Manually tested cases based on the description
    assert is_simple_power(1, 4) == True, "Failed on example case: is_simple_power(1, 4)"
    assert is_simple_power(2, 2) == True, "Failed on example case: is_simple_power(2, 2)"
    assert is_simple_power(8, 2) == True, "Failed on example case: is_simple_power(8, 2)"
    assert is_simple_power(3, 2) == False, "Failed on example case: is_simple_power(3, 2)"
    assert is_simple_power(3, 1) == False, "Failed on example case: is_simple_power(3, 1)"
    assert is_simple_power(5, 3) == False, "Failed on example case: is_simple_power(5, 3)"

    # Testing edge cases
    assert is_simple_power(0, 10) == False, "Failed on edge case: is_simple_power(0, 10)"
    assert is_simple_power(10, 1) == False, "Failed on edge case: is_simple_power(10, 1)"
    assert is_simple_power(1, 1) == True, "Failed on edge case: is_simple_power(1, 1)"
    
    # Negative number tests
    assert is_simple_power(-1, -1) == True, "Failed on negative case: is_simple_power(-1, -1)"
    assert is_simple_power(-8, -2) == True, "Failed on negative case: is_simple_power(-8, -2)"

    print("All tests passed!")
